ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned all about basic drawing skills

I learned to be more spontaneous, how to produce many paintings in a short amount of time, about many different artists' drawing styles, new techniques, and much more. This was possibly the course in which I've learned the most valuable art skills.
I gained an introductory skill set in drawing. I developed techniques in charcoal, pencil, and ink. I also learned a bit of art history as well.
Drawing techniques, critique skills, mediums
I learned about mark making, values, figure drawing, perspective, ink, pencil, a lot about how to use charcoal, and I can also now recognize a lot more famous drawings from lecture

I learned more than I could ever imagine in this course! From using pencil to charcoal, I was blown away by how much I took away from taking Basic Drawing. In addition to perspective drawing, figure drawing, abstract drawing, mark making, ink drawing, subtractive and additive drawing, etc., we also had the opportunity to learn about different artists and their styles ranging from Michelangelo to modern/contemporary artists.
I learned so much about the foundations of drawing and techniques for using different mediums.
Everything! I loved it. So many art skills
Perspective drawing, still lifes, deep and shallow space, figure drawing, abstraction, and how to work with ink and charcoal.
Learned how to carefully observe and critique others' artworks.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Was so good, no complaints
This course is only strengths. Everyone gave valuable comments at critiques, the assignments were academic but novel, and I learned a lot.
This class was incredible. Learned so much and Rachelle and Emmanuel both were amazing. Work was so fun and rewarding
The class environment was really supportive, the "fieldtrips" were great, and our TA was super helpful. No weaknesses in my opinion.

I absolutely loved Basic Drawing. You truly get to interact and work with art on a weekly basis and you grow so much. It was a little discouraging at times to be one of the only beginners in a "Basic" Drawing class, but I understand that there's only so much you can do when selecting people through Instructor Requests during registration period.
This was such an incredible class. The assignments are effective and fun, and I could really see myself improving as the weeks went on.
I think it was wonderful. Would not change a thing
This class was really fun! I think the assignments were engaging but also good for beginners like me who had never really drawn before.

Strengths: the instructors were very engaged and always had excellent insight about everyone's processes with their art and were very supportive. Weaknesses: some in-class drawing time was converted into critique time, and we would also sometimes run out of time for critiques near the end.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely - such a great course
Yes, I would. This class not only made me feel confident, but I learned a lot as well.

Absolutely. Even if you don't have much drawing skill, Rachelle and our teaching fellow Emmanuel were always eager to help and give feedback, and were always super understanding. The classes were very laid back, and focused on drawing in class to develop technique.
Yes, I would greatly recommend this course. Rachelle is an amazing professor, and I truly enjoyed this class.
YES! Amazing class. If you get the chance take this it will make life better and more interesting
Yes, totally amazing class, especially with Rachelle as a teacher. Don't underestimate the workload though, drawing takes time.

I would absolutely recommend Basic Drawing! If you are struggling to fulfill your humanities/arts (Hu) credit or want to take a fun (and very different) course during your time at Yale, this course is the one for you. It doesn't matter if you've never drawn in your life before. I was a total beginner and took away so much!
Yes! This is my favorite class I've taken at Yale so far. It's especially fun for someone who has never taken an art class before.
Absolutely. I think everyone should take this course at Yale
This was really fun to take as a stem major because I got to be creative and have fun.
Yes! Basic drawing is very fun for anyone regardless of drawing experience, and everyone grew so much through taking this class.
